raw_text:
Manics in charge of BBC 6 Music
 
 The Manic Street Preachers are to take over the helm of BBC digital radio station 6 Music for a week in December.
 
 The Welsh band, whose hits include Design For Life and If You Tolerate This, have already chosen which records to play between 6 and 12 December. Their albums of the day include Who's Next by The Who and U2's Joshua Tree. The group will also perform their own live session. They follow in the footsteps of Radiohead, who took over the station for a week last year.
 
 Bass player Nicky Wire will join Phil Jupitus on his morning show on Monday 6 December, while vocalist and guitarist James Dean Bradfield will appear on Andrew Collins' afternoon show on Thursday 9. The group have also chosen documentaries to air, such as The Leonard Cohen Story and Guitar Greats - Jimmy Page. The live concert session tracks they have picked include The Specials' Rat Race recorded at Hammersmith Odeon in London and Public Enemy's Fight The Power and Rebel Without A Pause. The band will also answer questions e-mailed in by 6 Music listeners.
llama3.2:1b: The Manic Street Preachers will take over BBC digital radio station 6 Music for a week in December, playing their albums of the day, including Who's Next by The Who and Joshua Tree by U2.
They will also perform live sessions with Phil Jupitus on Monday and Andrew Collins on Thursday.

They will also appear on specific shows with Phil Jupitus and Andrew Collins, and answer listener questions.

qwen2.5:0.5b: The Manic Street Preachers will take over BBC 6 Music for a week from December 6 to 9, performing their live sessions during the morning show and answering music-related questions via email.
They have released albums of the day, including "Who's Next" by The Who and Joshua Tree by U2, with Nicky Wire joining Phil Jupitus on his morning show.
James Dean Bradfield will appear on Andrew Collins' afternoon show for a special session track called "The Specials' Rat Race."
qwen2.5:1.5b: The Manic Street Preachers, known for their hit songs including "Design For Life" and "If You Tolerate This", have been appointed as the new DJs for BBC's digital radio station 6 Music from December 6-12.
They will be responsible for selecting tracks to play daily across the station, performing live sessions, airing documentaries, and answering listener questions in return.
qwen2.5:3b: The Manic Street Preachers, known for hits like Design For Life and If You Tolerate This, will take over BBC digital radio station 6 Music for a week in December.
They have selected music from albums like Who's Next by The Who and U2’s Joshua Tree, and include live sessions with band members.

Performances will occur on Monday and Thursday of the week, featuring documentaries such as The Leonard Cohen Story and Guitar Greats - Jimmy Page, along with tracks from events like The Specials' Rat Race and Public Enemy’s Fight The Power.
Additionally, listeners can submit questions to be answered by the band.

They have chosen which records to play between 6 and 12 December, including their own albums such as Who's Next by The Who and U2's Joshua Tree.
Their live sessions will follow with recordings from Hammersmith Odeon in London and documentaries like The Leonard Cohen Story and Guitar Greats - Jimmy Page.
They plan to answer questions e-mailed in by listeners.

deepseek-r1:1.5b: The Manics are managing BBC 6 Music for a week starting December 10th and ending on December 16th.

The Welsh band has chosen tracks including Design For Life, If You Tolerate This, Who's Next by The Who, Joshua Tree, and documentaries like "The Leonard Cohen Story" and "Guitar Greats - Jimmy Page."
Phil Jupitus will be hosting a live show on Dec 10th with bass player Nicky Wire.
James Dean Bradfield will appear on Andrew Collins' show on Dec 16th.
They'll perform live sessions, cover tracks such as The Specials' Rat Race at the Hammersmith Odeon and The Public Enemy's Fight The Power and Rebel Without A Pause.

They will also perform a live session and participate in shows, with Nicky Wire joining Phil Jupitus on December 6 and James Dean Bradfield appearing on Andrew Collins' show on December 9.
Their chosen albums include The Who's *Who's Next* and U2's *The Joshua Tree*, and they have selected live tracks from The Specials and Public Enemy.
The band will also answer listener questions via email.

granite3.1-dense:2b: The Manic Street Preachers, a Welsh band known for hits like "Design For Life" and "If You Tolerate This," are set to manage BBC 6 Music from December 6-12.
They've selected albums of the day, including The Who's "Who's Next" and U2's "Joshua Tree."
Members will also appear on respective shows: Nicky Wire on Phil Jupitus' morning slot (December 6) and James Dean Bradfield on Andrew Collins' afternoon show (December 9).
The band has chosen documentaries like "The Leonard Cohen Story" and "Guitar Greats - Jimmy Page," along with live tracks such as The Specials' "Rat Race" and Public Enemy's "Fight The Power."
They'll engage with listeners via pre-emailed questions, continuing a tradition started by Radiohead in 2018.
